item.title: 7 Epilogue
item.description: Becoming “Modern” Children born in the United States 1982–2002, the period bracketing the turn of the millennium, are known as Millennials, as those born in the decade after World War II, 1945–55, were dubbed Baby Boomers. Seeking labels for the generations of Andhra pandits discussed here we might call the old est set Traditionalists, a group that included Baballa, Lanka, Duvvuri Yajulu, Bulusu Cayanalu, and Gullapalli Sita Ram Sastri, as well as Renducintala Venkatacalu Yajulu, Kapilavayi Yajnesvara Agnihotra Sastri, and others.
